oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Rocky Toppers and Frazier Moss performances - Martin Junior High School - 1982-08-10
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performances of various tunes by The Rocky Toppers (performers), Clyde Troxell (performer), Virgil Anderson (performer), Alma Hodgin (performer), Frazier Moss (performer), Kris Allen (performer), and Elmer Hurst (performer) on August 10, 1982 at Martin Junior High School in Crossville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: The Rocky Toppers; Clyde Troxell; Alma Hodgin; Frazier Moss; Kris Allen; Elmer Hurst
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ralph Troxell talks and introduces Ray and Louella Souders [?] -- Coming Down (The Rocky Toppers) [unconfirmed] -- Ralph Troxell introduces the next tune -- Dance All Night (The Rocky Toppers) -- [Unidentified] asks where the groups musical background -- Ralph Troxell talks about his personal background and learning from his father -- Louella Souders talks about her musical background [unconfirmed] -- Ray Souders talks about his musical background -- Shortnin' Bread (The Rocky Toppers) -- Ralph Troxell introduces the next tune -- Blackberry Blossom (The Rocky Toppers) -- Lost John (The Rocky Toppers) -- [Unidentified] introduces Elmer Hurst -- Liza Jane (The Rocky Toppers, Elmer Hurst calls) -- Over the Waves (The Rocky Toppers) -- [Unidentified] talks -- Knoxville Rag (The Rocky Toppers) -- [Unidentified] introduces Elmer Hurst -- Elmer Hurst talks about his dancing and where he learned how to squaredance -- Virgil Anderson talks about his dancing -- [Unidentified tune] (The Rocky Toppers) -- Ralph Troxell introduces Clyde Troxell -- Clyde Troxell introduces himself and talks about his musical background -- There's More Pretty Girls Than One (Clyde Troxell) -- John Henry Blues (Clyde Troxell) -- Clyde Troxell talks -- [Unidentified tune] (Clyde Troxell) -- Clyde Troxell introduces the next tune [explicit content] -- Shortnin' Bread (Clyde Troxell) -- [Unidentified] introduces Virgil Anderson -- Virgil Anderson talks -- I Don't Like The Way My Women Do (Virgil Anderson) -- Virgil Anderson talks about places he has released and played music -- Banjo Pickin' Girl (Virgil Anderson) -- Don't Let Your Sweet Love Die (Virgil Anderson) -- Long Tall Mama Blues (Virgil Anderson) -- [Unidentified] asks Anderson a question -- Anderson talks tells a funny story (incomplete) -- Virgil Anderson talks -- [instrument tune up] -- Tennessee Shuffle On The Old State Line (Virgil Anderson) [unconfirmed] -- [Unidentified] asks Anderson about his roots -- Anderson talks about playing blue with anyone who wants to play and the influence of his father -- [Unidentified] says that Anderson will play one more tune -- She's My Curly Headed Baby (Virgil Anderson) -- Virgil Anderson talks -- [Unidentified] talks (incomplete) -- [Unidentified] talks -- Free Little Bird (Alma Hodgin) -- Hodgin introduces the next tune -- Picture On The Wall (Alma Hodgin) -- Hodgin talks about and introduces the next tune -- Barbara Allen (Alma Hodgin) -- [Unidentified] asks a question about the tune -- Hodgin answers and introduces the next tune -- Room Among The Angels (Alma Hodgin) -- Hodgin introduces the next tune -- Crawdad Song (Alma Hodgin) -- Hodgin introduces the next tune -- I'm Here To Get My Baby Out Of Jail (Alma Hodgin) -- [Unidentified guitar tune] -- Hodgin introduces the next tune -- Soldier's Last Letter (Alma Hodgin) (incomplete) -- Hodgin has trouble either remembering or playing the tune correctly -- Little Rosewood Casket (Alma Hodgin) -- There's A Hole In The Bottom Of The Sea (Alma Hodgin) -- [Unidentified] introduces Frazier Moss and Kris Allen -- Frazier Moss introduces the duo and introduces the first tune -- Katy Hill (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Moss talks about playing with Kris Allen and explains the categories of fiddling and the dances they accompany -- Over The Waves (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Moss introduces the next tune as a hornpipe -- Durang's Hornpipe (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Moss tells the story about how he got his first fiddle -- Moss talks about how complex the fiddle is and it's origins -- Moss introduces the next tune -- Red Wing (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen vocals, guitar) -- Moss introduces the next tune -- Up Jumped The Devil (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Moss introduces the next tune -- Tennessee Polka (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Moss introduces the next tune -- [Unidentified tune] (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Moss talks about young people taking interest in folk music and introduces the next tune -- [Unidentified fiddle reel] (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Sally Goodin (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Moss introduces the next tune and tells a bit of history about it -- Listen To The Mockingbird (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen guitar) -- Moss introduces takes a request for their last tune -- Rocky Top (Frazier Moss fiddle, Kris Allen vocals, guitar) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rocky Toppers (Musical group); Troxell, Ralph; Troxell, Clyde, 1911-1994; Anderson, Virgil, 1902-1997; Moss, Frazier; Allen, Kris;
